title: SMT201 Group 5
text:
Welcome to Derna EvacuConnect!
The project revolves around the theme of GIS-based Accessibility Analysis and Mapping of Emergency Evacuation Centres and Medical Services of Derna City, Libya. More specifically pre- and post-flood caused by Storm Daniel on Sunday 10 September 2023.


10 September 2023
Storm Daniel, the deadliest Medicane in history, pushed two dams in the Derna district of Libya to their limits, causing them to collapse.
The result? A massive flood that led to large-scale damage and destruction of buildings & infrastructure & thousands of casualties





  
    
    Before
  
  
    
    After
  






Casualty from disasters are tragic.
Evacuation Centres & Medical facilities exist to mitigate its impact, yet any disaster has the potential to reduce their effectiveness.



To prevent further loss of life, our analysis seeks to find out:
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†How Disaster-Proof & Accessible are Derna‚Äôs Evacuation Centres & Medical Facilities?





Data Preparation

Buildings are used as an approximation of Derna‚Äôs Residences in the network analysis.

Relevant Flood extent, Buildings, Roads, Evacuation Centres & Medical Facilities data are extracted.

Data Pre- & Post-Flooding are verified through high-resolution satellite images.

Layers are clipped to the study area & saved with the correct Libyan Projected Coordinates System (EPSG:3197).

Centroids for Buildings, Evacuation Centres and Medical Facilities are created.

Accessibility Analysis

QNEAT3 Plugin in QGIS, Network Analysis Toolbox utility Iso-Areas as Polygons (from Layer) are used to measure the accessibility of buildings to the Evacuation Centres & Medical Facilities.

Visualising Data

To easily visualise accessibility, categorised polygons with color ramps representing accessibility were created.
We also used various geoprocessing tools like merge and dissolve, to group common data together for a more comprehensive finding.





Derna‚Äôs Evacuation Centres & Medical Facilities are not very diaster-proof and accessibility decreases by a huge proportion even though only a small area of Derna City was destroyed by Storm Daniel.
Find out more in our poster and/or report!

title: Overview

title: Project Proposal
text:
Motivation of project
In the recent collapse of the Derna dam following intense rainfall, there was a high casualty count in the city of Derna due to a major flood. We decided to analyse and assess the accessibility of Derna City‚Äôs evacuation centres and medical services to evaluate the changes in the extent of such facilities effectiveness in rendering aid and medical services in an aftermath of a disaster such as the flood.


Project objective
Based on our motivation, we have 3 main objective for our project:

To find out the accessibility of Derna city‚Äôs evacuation centres and medical services.
To find out how disaster-proof the accessibility to the evacuation centres and medical services are.
To determine if accessibility of these facilities are the main cause of high death and missing toll.



Data

OSM Libya from Geofabrik
Libya Floods at Humanitarian Data Exchange portal

Libya Health Facilities
Location of Dams
Libya Buildings Footprint
Libya - 250m hexagonal grid and grid centres over city of Derna
more data dk yet




Scope of work


Project schedule

title: About
text:
We are a group of three Year 2 Information Systems students from Singapore Management University (SMU) majoring in Smart City Management and Technology (SMT).
In this website, we discuss about our work done and insights gained from the project!
Access our GitHub Repository here: GitHub.
Connect with us on LinkedIn (by clicking on our facesüòä):

  

This whole project wouldn‚Äôt be possible if not for the guidance and mentoring by the one and only Prof.¬†Kam Tin Seong.
